author: Arsene Lupin III
subject: FANFIC: Terror in Salivano Pt. 3
body:
Lupin III
Episode 3

She collapses to the floor. When she awakes, she sees the Archduke in
front of her. There is also a set of bars that run from floor to ceiling
between her and the Archduke. She prepares to charge at him, but realizes
her hands are tied behind her back. Her feet are also tied together. The
Archduke sees her spastic struggles to escape and laughs.

Archduke: Ha ha ha. So, the little traitor is awake, eh?
Fujiko: What do you mean, "traitor"? I did what you asked!
Archduke: Ah.tsk-tsk, my dear. 

The Archduke produces an audio cassette player from his pocket and
presses play on it with his thumb. A familiar conversation is repeated
over the small muffled speaker.

"Fujiko: You see, I also plan on taking the Archduke for every penny he's
got. You know me better than I suspected, Jigen. for someone who hates me
so."

He stops the tape.

Archduke: Now, if that isn't conspiracy against the government, I don't
know what is. You die at dawn.

The Archduke begins to turn away as Fujiko spits in his general
direction. The spit lands nowhere near the Archduke, but he gets the
message.

Archduke: Oh, I see. So you wish to die now, is that it?

Fujiko turns her head away as if to gesture to the contrary.

Archduke: Dawn it is, then.

The Archduke turns away and steps into the darkness.

Jigen: This whole thing is all your fault, you know.
Fujiko: Huh?

Fujiko looks around her to see that Jigen and Inspector Zenigata are tied
up behind her in the same cell, sitting against the worn brick wall.

Jigen: If you hadn't fallen for the Archduke's promises of wealth, you
might still have had a chance at getting your precious treasure. But no,
you had to bring us down too. 
Fujiko: I'm sorry, guys. I guess I just got greedy. What's Zenigata doing
in here?
Zenigata: I'll take this one. It seems the Archduke got a hold of the
recordings we made of Lupin's walkie-talkie conversation. When he.
Fujiko: Wait, you were listening in on Lupin's conversation?
Zenigata: Well, yes. 
Fujiko: How did you discover the frequency?
Zenigata: Interpol has its resources.
Jigen: He found the users' manual in Lupin's car.

Zenigata looks upset that Jigen revealed his secret.

Zenigata: Anyway, When the Archduke discovered that Lupin had found his
jackpot of death warrants, he locked me up to silence me.
Fujiko: Where are all your men?
Zenigata: Locked up elsewhere in the palace, probably.
Fujiko: Won't ICPO notice you're gone?
Zenigata: Personally, I don't think they're too worried about me.
Fujiko: So, what now?
Jigen: We wait for Lupin to show up. He's our last hope.
Fujiko: We're done for.


Lupin, alone in his hotel room, gathers his equipment. The moon has
already risen. He slips on his teal sports jacket, yellow tie, black
shirt and pants. He seems to know what he is going to do. Goemon arrives
at the door and enters the hotel room, sword in hand.

Goemon: So you've made your decision then?
Lupin: Yep. I've got to help Jigen. But I need your help, Goemon. Well,
you and that samurai sword of yours.
Goemon: So, what's the plan?
Lupin: Follow me.

Lupin grabs a small bag and slips it into an inside jacket pocket. They
both go out the other side of the building through a fire escape. Lupin
slips into the car he had rented earlier that week and takes off with
Goemon inside. Once outside of town, Goemon speaks.

Goemon: What makes you think you can help Jigen by leaving town?
Lupin: You'll see.

Lupin pulls over once they reach the spot of choice.

Lupin: Here's the place.
Goemon: A barren lot?
Lupin: That's what I thought the last time I was here.

Lupin and Goemon get out of the car and walk onto the small patch of
land.

Lupin: This parcel of land is important somehow. Goemon, could you slice
a neat little hole right here?

Lupin poiy are the prisoners startled, they are grateful.

Lupin: Well, well. Look who it is. Fujiko the backstabber. And our old
friend Zenigata. Oh, yeah. Jigen too.
Jigen: Thanks a lot, Boss.
Zenigata: Get us out of here, Lupin! If you don't get me out, I'll.!
Lupin: Tsk, tsk. Calm down, Inspector. First, Goemon here needs to do a
little abracadabra with his little sword.
Goemon: Please do not refer to my talents as cheap magic.
Lupin: Magic isn't cheap. It's very entertaining. Here, check this out. 

Lupin pulls out a coin and makes it disappear from his hand. He then
produces it from Goemon's ear. Lupin smiles grandly as if he has just
made a new friend. Unfortunately, this did not have the same effect on
Goemon. He simply frowns at Lupin.

Goemon: Idiot.
Lupin: Humph. Thanks a lot.

Goemon slashes apart the bars with ease, allowing Lupin to enter the
cell.

"Oh, yeah- he can sense danger. A POST-IT NOTE could sense danger better
than this guy!"

takes 30 seconds to 
realize he's being chased by a quarterback-sized Aztec in the
film "The Puma Man".
